data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: Hydrothermal Synthesis of a Dense Metal−Organic Layered Framework That Contains Cu(I)−Olefinic Bonds, Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2)

data.question: Who is the corresponding author of the paper?
What is the publication year of the article?
What method was used for the synthesis of the Cu(I) compound?
What is the yield of crystalline material based on Cu(CH3CO2)2?
What is the color of the needlelike crystals isolated from the synthesis?
What is the significance of the Cu(I) compound's coordination geometry?
data.answer: It is one of the few examples of trigonal planar Cu(I) in an extended solid framework.

data.question: Why is the title phase considered extraordinary?
data.answer: Because it has multiple unique crystallographic Cu(I) trigonal planar centers.

data.question: What does the presence of Cu(I) bonded to a C=C π-system indicate about the compound?
data.answer: It indicates classical and nonclassical Cu(I) bonding.

data.question: Is the title phase air-sensitive?
data.answer: False, the title phase is air-stable.

data.question: Does the title phase contain waters of hydration?
data.answer: False, the title phase curiously excludes water from the framework.

data.question: Is the Cu(2) center bonded to an olefinic group?
data.answer: False, Cu(2) is not bonded to an olefinic group.

data.question: Are all copper centers in the structure bonded to fumarate?
data.answer: True, each of the copper centers are bonded to fumarate.

data.question: Is the Cu(1) coordination sphere described as a pseudo trigonal pyramid?
data.answer: True, the Cu(1) coordination sphere is a pseudo trigonal pyramid.

data.question: Does the Cu(3b) center have a trigonal planar coordination?
data.answer: False, Cu(3b) is distorted square planar with bonds to three oxygen atoms.

data.question: Is the synthesis of the title phase highly reproducible?
data.answer: True, the synthesis was highly reproducible.

data.question: What is the role of hydrothermal synthesis in obtaining new solid state compounds?
data.answer: It provides an opportunity to obtain new solid state compounds with unusual oxidation states and coordination spheres.

data.question: What does the absence of voids in the title phase imply?
data.answer: It implies that there is no room for water molecules to insert into the copper−olefin bond, contributing to the absence of waters of hydration.
